Question
========

We draw a random sample among 2,100 adults. Suppose X is the number of people in the sample living unmarried with a partner. The probability that at least 1/3 of this sample is unmarried cohabiting can be written as:

Answerlist
----------

* P (X≥1/3).
* P (X≤700).
* P (X≥700).
* P (X≤ 1400).
* P (X≤ 2100).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P (X≥1/3)...: Incorrect
* P (X≤ 700)..: Incorrect
* P (X≥700): Correct
* P (X≤ 1400)..: Incorrect
* P (X≤ 2100)..: Incorrect
